Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Tachyplesin III (Tachyplesin 3, Tachyplesin-3; XXA, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; 2S=S; Horseshoe Crab, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 planktonic cells (MIC 2.0ug/ml) and P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 adherent cells (MIC 4.0ug/ml). Also active against E. coli DC2 CGSC 7139, E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 0.0625-0.5 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923, and S. aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC 1-8 uM).Chemical modification: Two disulfide bridges: 3,16; 7,12.Structure: NMR structures of both native and cyclic form have been solved (Vernen F et al., 2019).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.   Updated 4/2019; 9/2019
Literature Information.Author: Muta T, Fujimoto T, Nakajima H, Iwanaga S1989
Literature Information.Title: Tachyplesins isolated from hemocytes of Southeast Asian horseshoe crabs (Carcinoscorpius rotundicauda and Tachypleus gigas): identification of a new tachyplesin, tachyplesin III, and a processing intermediate of its precursor.
